content:
Diagnosis:	Left breast adenomyoepithelioma, malignant variant

Management:	15 Jan 2024 Wide local excision and sentinel lymph node biopsy

Histology:	pT1b (12mm) N0(0/2) M0 adenomyoepithelioma with malignant features
		Grade 2, ER 7/8, PR 6/8, HER2 negative, Ki67 15%
		AKT mutation not detected

Current Situation:	Routine follow-up post-surgery

I reviewed [redacted name] today for her first post-operative follow-up. She has made an excellent recovery from surgery with good wound healing. The final histology confirms a 12mm adenomyoepithelioma with malignant features, grade 2, with clear margins and no lymph node involvement. Her hormone receptor status is strongly positive and HER2 negative. Following discussion at the breast MDT on 29 Jan 2024, the recommendation is for adjuvant endocrine therapy alone given the low-risk features. We have prescribed tamoxifen 20mg daily for 5 years, which she will start next week. She understands the common side effects and the importance of reporting any new symptoms. She will be enrolled in our standard follow-up program with annual mammography. Her next clinic review will be in 6 months' time.

primary_cancer.histopathology_status: Grade 2 adenomyoepithelioma with malignant features, 12mm size, clear margins
primary_cancer.biomarker_status: ER 7/8 positive, PR 6/8 positive, HER2 negative, Ki67 15%, AKT mutation not detected

cancer_timeline.value: Wide local excision and sentinel lymph node biopsy
Final histology confirms 12mm adenomyoepithelioma with malignant features, grade 2, clear margins, nodes negative
Discussed at breast MDT - recommendation for adjuvant endocrine therapy alone

status_updates.value: Early stage left breast adenomyoepithelioma with excellent post-operative recovery. Low risk features suitable for endocrine therapy alone.
To commence tamoxifen 20mg daily for 5 years
Review in breast clinic in 6 months
